bug.author: itsharsh
bug.summary: Error: Network Error after PC Restart
bug.description:
CVAT was working fine. But after restarting my PC, I'm getting an error:
Could not check authorization on the server Error: Network Error.
So I tried to run it again using: <denchmark-code>docker-compose -y <yml file1> -y <yml file2>.... down docker-compose -y <yml file1> -y <yml file2>.... up -d --build </denchmark-code>
and its working again. But after restarting my PC, I'm getting the same error.

comments.comment: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/itsharsh>@itsharsh</denchmark-link> , probably it is really necessary to fix. The primary problem here is simple: inside container we have temporary apache files. The first command deletes these temporary files and apache can start again normally. It is a well-known problem with apache in a docker container: <denchmark-link:https://forums.docker.com/t/httpd-already-running/33397>https://forums.docker.com/t/httpd-already-running/33397</denchmark-link> . It seems it is necessary to remove apache2.pid file explicitly every time.

Okay, thanks for giving the actual reason for the bug. So, do I have to do that manually every time? By running this down and up command every time I start my PC. (Also, a startup script can do this for me). Or is there a permanent bug fix possible?

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/itsharsh>@itsharsh</denchmark-link> , it is possible to fix. Just need to remove the file explicitly: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/docker-library/php/blob/bdfd0fc1d19102cd6f951614072a51eabf7191bf/5.6/apache/apache2-foreground>https://github.com/docker-library/php/blob/bdfd0fc1d19102cd6f951614072a51eabf7191bf/5.6/apache/apache2-foreground</denchmark-link>

I cross-checked the existence of this apache2.pid file from the container bash (after restarting my pc again), but the folder is empty. <denchmark-code>docker exec -it cvat bash cd /var/run/apache2/ ls </denchmark-code>
This shows empty directory <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14810684/72141159-5322a580-33b8-11ea-9f3e-9836f9e7c8ca.jpg></denchmark-link>
Same issues, same situation on /var/run/apache2/. Is empty. Any other idea?

pid file (httpd.pid) located here /tmp/mod_wsgi-localhost:8080:1000/. Directory name is generated by mod_wsgi during start up I guess. According mod_wsgi documentation it should be possible specify pid file location <denchmark-code>--pid-file FILE-PATH Specify an alternate file to be used to store the process ID for the root process of the web server. </denchmark-code>
